messages.title: Supporting Local Businesses
messages.content: I have been listening to small businesses – from farmers' markets to Walton retailers – and embedding the local Chambers of Commerce.

messages.title: Fighting for a Fairer Deal for Local Services
messages.content: Surrey pays the Treasury £5.5 billion in taxes each year, but for years this affluent region gets less public services funding per head than elsewhere. Enough is enough.

messages.title: Promoting Community Spirit
messages.content: Walton has a thriving community spirit. We have the longest shopping street after Knightsbridge and numerous fairs and regular sport and community association charities.

messages.title: Protecting the Greenbelt
messages.content: Pressure to build new houses is threatening Elmbridge's greenbelt. I will champion stronger local powers to preserve our environment.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Listening to small businesses and embedding the local Chambers of Commerce.
Argues that Surrey pays a lot in taxes but gets less funding per head; fighting for a fairer share.
Promotes Walton's community spirit and shopping street, supports fairs and community associations.
Aiming to protect Elmbridge's greenbelt from housing pressures by advocating for stronger local powers.

issues.economy: Supporting small businesses and fighting for a fairer deal in public services funding.
issues.environment: Protecting the Greenbelt by advocating for stronger local powers to preserve the environment.
issues.governance: Advocating for better local governance, particularly in terms of fair funding and decision power to protect the greenbelt.

housing.content: Pressure to build new houses is threatening Elmbridge's greenbelt.

leaflet.personalStatement: My job between now and a general election involves three things. First, serving as a sturdy champion in Elmbridge as positively as possible - listening to residents, businesses and community groups.

images.caption: Dominic Raab with his wife Erika at a fete in Walton
